content.description: A little more sporty start than J.R.'s Crumble. Join J.R.'s Crumble for 2-3 moves and then follow the (green in photo) faint water course up the middle of the face.  Good hands and feet.  Loosen the shoulders for a few good reaches.  If there has been any recent percipitation, this route may best be left for a day to dry out.  Enjoy the view from the top.
content.protection: Top rope the large tree at the ledge 3/4 of the way to the top.
content.location: Starts in the less obvious dihedral at the center of the base of the crag.

content.description: From the obvious base of the crag follow the main flake up and left until it goes vertical up the face.  Follow the path of least resistance up to the top rope anchor.  Enjoy the view over looking the Stillwater Valley from the top!
content.protection: Set a top rope around a bomber tree at the ledge 3/4 of the way to the top of the crag, good access from the top.  Pro could be chosy if done as a trad route.
content.location: Start at the base of the large flake at the obvious base of the crag.
